alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 2:50AM PST until January 08 at 1:04PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding and widespread lowland flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt continues. Expect flood waters to begin receding this morning, but it will be a gradual process as water works its way down each creek and river system. * WHERE...Clatsop County and far northwestern Columbia County in northwest Oregon and Pacific County and western portions of Wahkiakum County in southwest Washington. * WHEN...Until 915 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding including portions of US101 in both Pacific and Clatsop Counties, Washington Highway 4 and Washington Highway 6. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 AM PST, Emergency management, the public and law enforcement have reported widespread flooding in the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen over the past 24-30 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Astoria, Seaside, Warrenton, Cannon Beach, Long Beach, Cathlamet, Grays River, Frances, Jewell, Ocean Park, Raymond, Clatskanie, South Bend, Ilwaco, Rosburg, Knappa, Naselle, Skamokawa, Lebam and Hammond Town. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
